Published November 30 2014

Are locksmiths who work more slowly perceived as more skilled?

Are locksmiths who work more slowly perceived as more skilled? — “What this reveals is that consumers don’t value goods and services solely by their utility, benefit from the service, but also a sense of fairness relating to how much effort was exerted.” Interesting hypothesis. Thoughts?

Enjoy your day.
